Headline: 3rdEngr/2nd Asst Engr| Founder @ NANDIX | Marine Engineer | Building India‚Äôs First Autonomous Retail Intelligence Engine | Making Retail Self-Driving Engineer | Adaptive Problem Solver
Comment:
AS a founder building a SaaS product, the real battlefield isn‚Äôt always the idea or the tech‚Ä¶ it's assembling the right core team. Everyone today has commitments, bills, and expectations. Most great talent wants market salaries from day one, but earlystage startups run on conviction long before cash flow. That gap b/w belief and bank balance  is where many founders get crushed.

Finding people who can think like owners, not employees, who‚Äôll build the foundations before the rewards show up‚Ä¶ that's the rarest resource in today‚Äôs ecosystem. Tech can be learned, distribution can be hacked  but aligning a team that shares the same obsession as the founder is where most SaaS dreams stall....

Sometimes I feel building the product is the easy part; building the team is the real startup...üòÆ‚Äçüí®

Headline: SCMHRD‚Äô27 (MBA) | Aspiring Sales & Marketing Professional | Passionate about Brand Strategy, Consumer Insights & Digital Marketing | Skilled in SEO, AI Tools & Content Strategy | Member - Guest Lecture Team
Comment: Point D (Luck) is the one variable business schools struggle to teach. We often reverse-engineer successful case studies as if they were pure strategic genius, ignoring the massive role of 'Right Place, Right Time.' Acknowledging luck isn't discounting hard work; it's a sign of intellectual honesty. Refreshing to hear.
